name: Document Title: ITP-192-CIV-Brunt Rd - Handrails (Supply & Install)
ITP Description: Brunt Rd - Handrails (Supply & Install)
ITP created by: Sandy Escalona/ Derek Collins
ITP approved for use by: Sandy Escalona
Reference - IFC Drawings VicRoads Section 610 & 630, AS 1252, AS 5100.6, AS 5131:216
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete Mix is Registered with VicRoads.
○ Concrete mix meets strength, grade, and maximum aggregate size as detailed on IFC drawings (32MPa)
Frequency - Once, for each mix design, 4 weeks prior to placement of concrete
Verifying Documents - ConQA/ TB Hold Point Release

Acceptance Criteria - Subcontractor is responsible for preparation and verification of shop drawings. Prior fabrication, shop drawings are to be verified by a competent Structural Steel Engineer. Evidence of this review and competency of the reviewer shall be submitted to Nominated Authority.
Verifying Documents - ConQA/ TB Hold Point Release

Acceptance Criteria - The Subcontractor shall submit to the Nominated Authority the steel manufacturer’s Certificate of Product Compliance and all related test certificates demonstrating compliance to the relevant steel product standards listed in Table 630.071, including all impact test values when appropriate.
○ The test certificates shall be related to the steel by trademarks and heat number.
Frequency - Once, for each mix design, 4 weeks prior to placement of concrete
Verifying Documents - ConQA/ TB Hold Point Release
Reference - IFC Drawings, Manufacture's Installation Guideline
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and sub contractors are:
○ Using the correct and complete set of IFC drawings (latest revision as per TeamBinder)
Frequency - Once, prior to the commencement of activities
Acceptance Criteria - Set out work in accordance with IFC Drawings.
○ The work shall be constructed in accordance with the confirmed set out to the line and level and cross-sectional profiles as shown on the drawings
○ Attach: Lot Map-marked up drawing to indicate the location of the Lot
Reference - IFC Drawings, Manufacturer's Installation Guideline
Acceptance Criteria - Footings to be constructed by Superintendent following IFC Drawings and Manufacturer's Installation Guidelines.
5.2 - Installing Structures on site snug-tight Condition or tensioned using the Part-turn method if required
Reference - IFC Drawings AS 1252, AS 5100.6, Manufacturer's Installation Guideline
Acceptance Criteria - Bolts shall be installed as per AS 1252 & AS5100.6. All bolts to be supplied complete with nut, locknut (where specified) & washer.
Reference - IFC Drawings AS 1252, AS 5100.6, Manufacturer's Installation Guideline
Acceptance Criteria - Superintendent to survey posts and confirm it is within tolerances prior to grouting base plates. Grout as per Engineering specifications.
Reference - IFC Drawings, Approved shop drawings

Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that works were constructed as per IFC & approved shop drawings. Subcontractor and Superintendent must inspect works for damages and rectification of defects, including but not limited to protective coating and painting touch ups.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure compliance for railing heights and offsets from pathways
Reference - IFC Drawings, Table VR Table 610.051, VR Clause 610.16
Acceptance Criteria - 7 day compressive strength to comply with table 610.051 for early indication that the strength is tracking correctly.
○ 28 day compressive strength (average of the 2 no. cylinders) per sample comply with the design strength.
○ Note: 1 of the 2 no. 28 day cylinders per sample may be as low as 90% of the required strength, so long as the average meets the required strength.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot/ element/ work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
Frequency - Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed above have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
